content.description:
Ipse1 sinu praeprae, prep. (+ acc.): before, in front of  se portans2 iuga longa petebat 
solorum nemorum: tela undiqueundique, adv. = ubique saeva premebant 
et circumfusocircumfundo, -ere, -fusi, -fusum: to surround volitabantvolito, -are = volo, -are milite VolsciVolsci, -orum, m. pl.: the Volsci.
 1:refers to Metabus, the father of Camilla ↩
2:Supply Camillam.↩
content.question: The metrical pattern of the first four feet of line 2 (solorum...premebant) is

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
